title: Shakra - The Best (2-CD) 2015 320ak
description:
Shakra - The Best (2-CD) 2015 320ak

Shakra is a Swiss hard rock band founded in the late 1990s.
Singer Pete Wiedmer was forced to leave the band because of ill health, replaced by Mark Fox. 
By touring with Great White and Uriah Heep, the career of this Swiss band was a steep learning curve with dramatic success.

Mark Fox put his stamp on the following album "Rising" (2003), which saw Shakra rise higher on the career ladder than ever before. 
And, after supporting Iron Maiden at the Swiss "Spirit Of Rock" festival, Shakra then took the decision to tour through 12 countries with HammerFall and Stratovarius. 
The band played several concerts and festivals, one of which was the prestigious "Bang Your Head" event. 

The controversial video clip for the song "Chains Of Temptation" showed singer Fox giving himself a heroin injection. The band played a huge show in Zurich with Guns N' Roses in 2006.

Shortly after Mark Fox left the band and was replaced by John Prakesh on vocals.


On April 23, 2014, John Prakesh announced he was leaving Shakra.'

October, 2015, Mark Fox joined Shakra again. A new single, Hello, was released.

In 2016 "High Noon" Will be released to be followed by a tour. No further details at this time.
